comments.body: can we just do `case c: Cast => UnresolvedAlias(c, Some(Column.generateAlias))`?

Seems we can't. This code will strip the `attribute` which is below the `Cast` so I leave it.

A example, with the code, `spark.range(1).selectExpr("CAST(CAST(id as int) as double)").columns` will return the `c1` instead of `CAST(CAST(c1 as INT) as DOUBLE)`.
add some comments to explain the reason.
So we can do `cast(CharType)`? It actually casts to StringType? But don't we loss length info?

If you do `col.cast("char(5)")` before this PR, Spark already silently treats it as cast to string type. I don't want to change this behavior here. We can make it better later, by failing explicitly and saying that cast to char type is not supported.
